member.name: T:ISC.Instrument.Driver.SafeCoreDatalogPacketizer
member.summary: Manages the packets of hygiene data that are downloaded from instrument.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.SafeCoreDatalogPacketizer.Add(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Push a packet onto the end of the queue.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.SafeCoreDatalogPacketizer.Pop
member.summary: Remove the first packet at the front of the queue and return it.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.SafeCoreDatalogPacketizer.Peek
member.summary: Return the packet at the front of the queue, leaving it at the front of the queue.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.SafeCoreDatalogPacketizer.CheckCrc(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Each record has a CRC appended at the end. This is a CRC computed at the time the record was written to the instrument's dataflash. We need to check the CRC's to detect corrupt record. Any invalid CRCs mean we have a corrupt dataflash and the hygiene is invalid.
member.exception: CorruptHygieneException is thrown if an invalid CRC is found

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.factoryShutdown
member.summary: Places the instrument into factory sleep mode.
member.remarks:
When instrument is in factory sleep mode, it will continue to respond to Modbus communication until it is undocked.
When undocked, the instrument will automatically power down, even if the AlwaysOn option is enabled, and if the security code is set.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.setEquipmentSubType(ISC.Instrument.TypeDefinition.EquipmentSubType)
member.summary: Sets the instrument's sub-type.
member.remarks: Note that the sub-type can only be set when the instrument is in factory-unitialized mode.
member.param: Must be either EquipmentSubType.VentisPro4 or EquipmentSubType.VentisPro5.
member.exception: Thrown if passed-in value is not VentisPro4 or VentisPro5.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.beginConfiguration
member.summary: Placed the instrument into mode.
member.exception: Thrown if instrument will not enter mode.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.getDualSenseCalRequestedFlag
member.summary: Returns the instrument's "cal requested" flag.
member.remarks: When the two sensors in dual sense mode have huge differences in their individual readings, the instrument assumes they need to be calibrated - because maybe one is bad - so, the instrument set's a flag for itself. It causes the Cal Due alert when set.
member.returns: True if the flag is set; else false.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.setDualSenseCalRequestedFlag(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the instrument's "cal requested" flag.
member.remarks:
When the two sensors in dual sense mode have huge differences in their individual readings, the instrument assumes they need to be calibrated - because maybe one is bad - so, the instrument set's a flag for itself. It causes the Cal Due alert when set.
This method allows an the flag the be set externally by an application; this is necessary and only intended for configuring the instrument.
member.param: True to set the flag, false to clear the flag

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.endConfiguration
member.summary: This method should be called at the end of configuring the instrument. The methods waits for the instrument to exit mode.
member.remarks: The instrument is considered configured if it's mode changes to either to . The instrument will change to this mode after being successfully configured because it automatically reboots itself, which then causes it to go through its warmup routine.
member.exception: Thrown if instrument remains stuck in mode or enters an unexpected mode.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.CheckConfigParameters
member.summary: This is a helper method for endConfiguration().
member.remarks: After an instrument is configured, it saves the newly configured register values to flash memory and then reboots. Once this happens, its firmware needs to read the parameters back out of the flash memory. This routine polls the CONFIG_PARAMETERS_INITIALIZED register to 87 to determine when the instrument is done doing this. This register is 0 when the instrument is powered on. When the instrument parameters are completely read out of Flash memory, it is set to 1. If the instrument is set to Factory Uninitialized mode, the value is set to 0 again.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.configureSensors
member.summary: Configures the duel sensors' settings so that they are in sync with each other.
member.remarks:
Calling this method causes the instrument to read the settings for its installed duel sensors, determine any differences between the pairs, then modifying (if necessary) any settings on them in order to make the settings the same between them.
The sensors "settings" are fields such as Low, High, STEL, and TWA alarms and, also, the peak reading.

remarks.para: Note that this should always be enabled for all customers' instruments.
This setting was introduced to iQuad 1.2 and is available in all versions of Ventis.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.isSelfTestInvokedWhileWarmUpCompleted
member.summary: The flag that will indicate whether a self-test invoked while in warm-up mode has completed.
member.remarks: This feature is applicable only from Ventis Pro 2.0. Ideally this should be called only if firmware version is 2.0 or above This flag must be queried by applications communicating with Ventis Pro instruments so that subsequent actions can be taken on those instruments It resets back when instrument restarts.
member.returns: Whether the self test invoked while in warm-up mode has completed
member.exception: Supported only in v2.0 or later.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.runSelfTest
member.summary: Tells the instrument to perform self tests on itself.
member.remarks: The instrument's self tests take around 8 - 9 seconds to run. This method will wait until they they are completed before it returns.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.getOomAlarmInterval
member.summary: The amount of time that will elapse from when no motion is first detected, until the OOM ("Out-of-Motion") Alarm is initiated.
member.returns: Returned value is in seconds.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.VentisProFactoryDriver.setOomAlarmInterval(System.Int32)
member.summary: The amount of time that will elapse from when no motion is first detected, until the OOM ("Out-of-Motion") Alarm is initiated.

remarks.note: Although the related "OOM Warning Interval" can be changed by the user, this OOM Alarm Interval setting is a factor-only setting. The instrument will only allow this setting to be modified when it is in FactoryUninitialized mode. If this method is called when the instrument is in some other mode, then the instrument will not change the setting.

IndicatorFailures.RightLed
IndicatorFailures.VibratingMotor
IndicatorFailures.Speaker
For older instruments, IndicatorFailures.None is returned.

member.name: T:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmActionMessageGroup
member.remarks:
Some instruments have new feature called "Alarm Action Messages".
Users can specify messages like "Evacuate" or "Wear Respirator" that are to be displayed on the instrument whenever the instrument is in alarm.
Each sensor type can have its own unique set of messages, and for a given sensor type, the messages can be unique for each alarm type (gas alert alarm, low alarm, high alarm, TWA alarm, and STEL alarm).
The messages are stored in the instrument, not on the sensor. The number of AlarmActionMessageGroups that an instrument is capable storing is typical equal to the to how many sensors can be installed in the instrumement. Call to determine the actual number for a given instrument type.
To determine the string length of the messages, call .

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmActionMessageGroup.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.param: The sensor code that the alarm applies to. e.g. "S0020" for Oxygen sensors.
The text message that is displayed when sensor is in alert. A null value is allowed and will treated as if an empty List was passed in.
The text message that is displayed when sensor is in Low alarm. A null value is allowed and will treated as if an empty List was passed in.
The text message that is displayed when sensor is in High slarm. A null value is allowed and will treated as if an empty List was passed in.
The text message that is displayed when sensor is in STEL alarm. A null value is allowed and will treated as if an empty List was passed in.
The text message that is displayed when sensor is in TWA alarm. A null value is allowed and will treated as if an empty List was passed in.

member.name: T:ISC.Instrument.Driver.BufferClaim
member.remarks:
The instrument utilizes two circular buffers, one for the header table and another for the datalogtable. Each record of the datalog table 'owns' a section of the datalog table. That section of the datalog table is indicated by a range of pages startPage to endPage-1 .
As the datalogtable grows, it will eventually rollover to the point where old data is re-written. As old datalog data is over-written, the old headers are NOT cleared. This results in the situation of having multiple headers claim the same datalog pages.
This situation is addressed by uploading the most recent headers first. As the headers are uploaded, they 'claim' a piece of datalog space. If that space is already claimed, then that header, and all subsequent headers are ignored.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.BufferClaim.Initialize(System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Initialize the buffer segment with the first claim.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.BufferClaim.ClaimBufferSegment(System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Returns false if buffer segment has been already claimed. Returns true if claim is successful. Adds new buffer segment to total claim.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.BufferClaim.EndAdjust(System.UInt16)
member.summary: The buffer segment is defined as all elements from and including the start element up to , but NOT including, the end element

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.BufferClaim.BufferSegmentAdd(System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Adds bufferSegment to the claimSegment. Buffer segment must precede claimBuffer.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.BufferClaim.BufferSegmentIntersection(System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Determines if the claimBufferSegment instersects with the new bufferSegment. Checks to see if either the start or end point of one buffer, falls within the space of the other buffer.

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.BufferClaim.InBufferSegment(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Determines if the specified element is with the specified buffer

member.name: T:ISC.Instrument.Driver.Resolution
member.summary: The Resolution class is used to represent the 'resolution' or 'decimal places' for a particular sensor.
member.remarks:
All values on a sensor are integral.
But there is an implied'resolution' that a sensor has that can be used to convert the integral values to decimal values.
e.g., if a sensor has a particular integer value of 195, and the resolution is 1 decimal place, then when the resolution is 'applied' to the integer value, it becomes 19.5.
INSTANCES OF THIS CLASS ARE IMMUTABLE. AT LEAST THEY'RE SUPPOSED TO BE.

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Number of decimal places. e.g. 2 for 0.01
member.exception: If invalid decimal places is specified

member.exception: If invalid decimal places is specified

member.summary: Given a double value, this routine will determine the resolution of that value.
member.remarks: e.g. given "1.23", this routine will return a Resolution with DecimalPlaces of 2.
member.exception: If passed-in value's decimal places exceeds MaxDecimalPlaces

member.summary:
Returns a double that can be 'applied' to an integer value to convert it to decimal.
e.g., if resolution is 2 decimal places, then 0.01 is returned.
e.g. 25000 * 0.001 = 2.5

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.Resolution.DecimalPlaces
member.summary: Returns the number of decimal places the sensor is programmed for. e.g. "2". This is the same value as originally specified in the constructor.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.Resolution.MaxDecimalPlaces
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of decimal places this class supports.

member.summary:
Returned format is "Code @ Timestamp".
e.g. "407 @ 01/27/12 13:46:14

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.InstrumentError.Code
member.summary: Returns the error number of this instrument error

member.summary: Returns when this instrument error occurred.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.InstrumentError.BaseUnitSerialNumber
member.summary: The base unit that module was in when the alarm occurred. Only used with SafeCore modules; will be empty for all other instrument types.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.InstrumentError.Category
member.summary:
The type of error (i.e., an Instrument error or a Base Unit error).
Will always be an Instrument error for all instrument types other than SafeCore.
For SafeCore, the type can be either Instrument or BaseUnit.

member.name: T:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent
member.summary: AlarmEvent

member.name: M:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.Clone
member.summary: Returns a duplicate copy of this AlarmEvent object.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.IsDualSense
member.summary: True if the AlarmEvent is for a physical sensor that was in DualSense mode at the time of the alarm. Not used for Tango.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.MeasurementType
member.summary: Will be Unknown for instruments that don't log the measurement type.
member.remarks: Will always MeasurementType.Unknown for MX6 alarm events.)

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.GasCode
member.summary: The "GasCode" of the gas type. i.e., if GasType is "H2S", then the returned gas code is "G0002".

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.SensorCode
member.summary: The sensor code of the sensor. e.g., "S0002" for an H2S sensor alarm event.
member.remarks: Will always be empty for MX6 alarm events.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.SensorSerialNumber
member.summary: The Serial number of the sensor.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.Timestamp
member.summary: The time (calendar date and time) that the alarm event occurred.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.Duration
member.summary: The length of time that the alarm event lasted.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.DurationSeconds
member.summary: The length of time that alarm event lasted, in seconds.

remarks.note:
APPLICATIONS SHOULD NOT CALL THIS PROPERTY. APPLICTIONS SHOULD CALL THE PROPERTY, INSTEAD.
This property only exists because the property is not serializable (it is a TimeSpan property, and TimeSpan is not serializable). While applications should not and cannot call this property, the .Net serializer is able to call this property in order to serialize/deserialize the 'duration' of the alarm event.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.PeakReading
member.summary: The peak reading seen in the duration of the event.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.AlarmHigh
member.summary: The high alarm setting at time of event.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.AlarmLow
member.summary: The low alarm setting at time of event.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.User
member.summary: The instrument's active user at time of event. May be empty.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.Site
member.summary: The instrument's active site at time of event. May be empty.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.UserAccessLevel
member.summary: For proximity alarms, this will be set to the instrument's access level at the time of the alarm.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.SiteAccessLevel
member.summary: For proximity alarms, this will be set to the site's (a.k.a beacon's) access level at the time of the alarm.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.BaseUnitSerialNumber
member.summary: The base unit that module was in when the alarm occurred. Only used with SafeCore modules; will be empty for all other instrument types.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.Ticks
member.summary: The ticks value. Used only for GBPlus instruments.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.SpeakerVoltage
member.summary: The speaker voltage. Used only for GBPro instruments.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.VibratingMotorVoltage
member.summary: The vibrating motor voltage. Used only for GBPro instruments.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.AlarmOperatingMode
member.summary: The operating mode at time of alarm. Used only for GBPro instruments.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.IsDocked
member.summary: Indicates if the was instrument docked at the time the event occurred. Used only for GBPro instruments.

member.name: P:ISC.Instrument.Driver.AlarmEvent.Positions
member.summary: The position number(s) of the sensor at the time of the gas operation.
member.remarks: This will only be filled in for certain instrument types; e.g. SafeCore. Will be a empty if not supported the instrument type.
